title: Types of Indian Paintings-Different kinds of Indian traditional folk Paintings.
description:
Welcome!
Explore the vibrant world of Indian traditional folk paintings, each reflecting the unique culture and stories of its region.

Madhubani: From Bihar, known for bright colors and mythological themes.

Warli: Tribal art from Maharashtra, using simple white shapes on mud walls.

Pattachitra: Scroll paintings from Odisha, showcasing gods and epics.

Pithora: Ritual wall paintings from Gujarat with sacred symbols.

Kalamkari: Andhra Pradeshâ€™s hand-painted fabric art with epic stories.

Thangka: Himalayan scrolls depicting Buddhist deities and mandalas.

Indian folk paintings are timeless expressions of devotion, nature, and culture.

Thank you for watching!
author: Riya Sharma
